entries.english: T (t): Tene na tene na tene (forever and ever), Tinia taama maita matano (cut fabric 5 times), Tara mbeca (count money), Tooria (accomplish), Teta (complain). Th (th): Thaani ĩno nĩ theru (this plate is clean), Thooma ũtarĩ na itherũ (read without joking), Thenga/ehera haha (move away from here), Thutha wa nyumba (behind the house). Ny (ny): Ruga nyanya na nyeni (cook tomatoes and greens), Mũrarũ nĩ nyoka (Mũrarũ is a snake), Nyamũ cia gĩthaka (wild animals), Nyeni nĩ njega (vegetables are good), Nyenje ĩ gĩko (cockroach is dirty)
entries.kikuyu: Consonant Practice Sentences - T, Th, Ny

entries.english: 11-13: Ikumi na ĩmwe (11), Ikũmi na igĩrĩ (12), Ikũmi na ithatũ (13). 20+: Mĩrongo (archaic for 'ten', used from 20 onwards). Mĩrongo ĩĩrĩ (20, literally 'two tens'), Mĩrongo ĩĩrĩ na ĩmwe (21), Mĩrongo ĩtatũ (30), Mĩrongo kenda na kenda (99). 100+: Igana rĩmwe (100), Igana rĩmwe na ĩmwe (101), Igana rĩmwe rĩa mĩrongo ĩĩrĩ (120), Igana rĩmwe rĩa mĩrongo ĩna na ĩmwe (141), Igana rĩmwe rĩa mĩrongo kenda na kenda (199). 1000: Ngiri ĩmwe. 1,000,000: Mirioni ĩmwe (borrowed from English 'million')
